column4: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.

column2: 22. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.

column2: 23. A speed restriction sign:

column2: 24. Your blind spot is the area of the road:

column8: you cannot see without moving your head.

column2: 25. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: in the direction you want to go.
column6: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column8: to keep the front wheels straight.
column10: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
